content.webTitle: Key stage 2 (age 7-11) Pupils' resource: The ancient Egyptian calendar

fields.headline: The ancient Egyptian calendar
fields.bodyText: How does our modern (Gregorian) calendar differ from that of the Egyptians? Which gods were remembered on the Egyptian calendar? What are the names of the seasons given on the calendar? See if you can find out how many days were on the Egyptian calendar in a year. What other calendars are there, past and present? The New Year: Five days devoted to the celebration of the New Year. This took place in the summer. 1. The month of Thuthy. The first month of the season of Akhet, the inundation. The birth of Re was remembered at this time. 2. The month of Paopy. The second month of Akhet. The feast of Osiris took place in this month. 3. Hathys. The third month of Akhet. Offerings are given to the Nile. 4. Choiach. The fourth month of Akhet. Sacred crocodiles are remembered in this month. 5. The season of Poret (emergence) begins with the month of Tyby. The sky feast takes place in this month. 6. The month of Menchir, second month in Poret. The festivals of little heat and great heat take place during this month. 7. The month of Famenoth, third month of Poret. The feast of Horus takes place, in which offerings are made to the dead. 8. The month of Parmuthy, fourth month of Poret. Offerings are made to Sokar, Horus, Ra, Ptah and Osiris. 9. The month of Pachons in the season of Shomu (harvest). The Festival of Isis took place. 10. Paony, the second month of Shomu. This included the day of purifying all things. 11. Epipy, the third month of Shomu. There was a seven-day feast during this month at the temple of Sokar. 12. The month of Mesore. Fourth month of Shomu. Horus is the god of this, the final month of the year.
